docs.snippet: It has no incentive to do so. I would know — I worked there.

headline.main: We Can’t Trust Facebook to Regulate Itself

docs.snippet: Healthy democracies have transparency in political advertising. That doesn’t matter to Facebook.
A former privacy policy adviser at Facebook takes issue with an Op-Ed article.
Calls for donations have been popping up more often on newsfeeds, after Facebook eliminated fees and made it easier to donate to fund-raisers.

headline.main: Yes, More Facebook Friends Are Asking You for Money

docs.snippet: Ramzan Kadyrov and Russian officials challenged Facebook’s decision to end his Instagram and Facebook accounts after the U.S. hit him with sanctions.

docs.snippet: Wherever Mark Zuckerberg goes in Silicon Valley, he seems to generate a housing problem, including at an R.V. community where residents were evicted this month.

headline.print_headline: As Facebook Settles In, Residents Move Out

docs.snippet: In a remarkable blog post, Facebook cited research showing that “passively consuming” social media made people feel worse. It also said it was trying to fix the problem.
